title: 105_hr4852
content: SECTION 1. PROPERTY SUBJECT TO A LIABILITY TREATED IN SAME MANNER AS ASSUMPTION OF LIABILITY. Repeal of Property Subject to a Liability Test in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, sections 357, 358, and 368 are amended to remove references to property subject to a liability. The acquiring corporation is subject to the determination of liability assumed under the Internal Revenue Code. This includes the treatment of recourse liabilities and agreements to satisfy such liabilities. The Internal Revenue Code specifies the treatment of nonrecourse liabilities assumed by the transferee of an asset, with exceptions and regulations to be prescribed by the Secretary. The Internal Revenue Code specifies regulations for the treatment of liabilities assumed by the transferee of an asset, with limitations on basis increase. The Secretary may prescribe regulations for the treatment of liabilities assumed under this subsection. The Internal Revenue Code specifies regulations for the treatment of liabilities assumed by the transferee of an asset, with limitations on basis increase. Gain recognized by the transferor due to assumption of a nonrecourse liability by a transferee is determined based on relative fair market values. The Internal Revenue Code specifies regulations for the treatment of liabilities assumed by the transferee of an asset, with limitations on basis increase. Gain recognized by the transferor due to assumption of a nonrecourse liability by a transferee is determined based on relative fair market values. This applies to provisions other than Subchapter C, such as Section 584(h)(3) which defines "assumed liabilities" for common trust funds transferred to regulated investment companies. The Internal Revenue Code outlines regulations for liabilities assumed by a transferee of an asset, with restrictions on basis increase. Gain recognized by the transferor from assumption of a nonrecourse liability by a transferee is determined based on relative fair market values. Amendments are made to sections 1031 and 351(h)(1) regarding the treatment of liabilities assumed by the transferee. Amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code regarding the treatment of liabilities assumed by a transferee of an asset. The changes include striking certain language related to liabilities and acquisitions. These amendments apply to transfers made after October 18, 1998.
